page.title: 11Daventry Country Park.
page.content: History of the reservoir. The reservoir covers 80 acres and was built in the hey-day of canal building, as a feeder to the canals. James Brindley's name has been associated with the reservoir which was finished in 1804. the country park was taken over by the council 10 years ago. Work to convert it was carried out by the District and County Councils as well as community services. Today there is one main picnic area with tables scattered around. Part of the bank is owned by th Daventry Angling Club and a regular use of the park is made by the Daventry Windsurfing Club, Model Boat Club and the Daventry Boys Club Canoe Group.
